column2: Definition
ACTFL World-Readiness Standards for Language Learning are integrated into the focus and review.
ACTFL World-Readiness Standards for Language Learning are integrated into the teacher input.
ACTFL World-Readiness Standards for Language Learning are integrated into the guided practice.
ACTFL World-Readiness Standards for Language Learning are integrated into the independent practice.
ACTFL World-Readiness Standards for Language Learning are integrated into the closure.
Lesson has a meaningful context in which students are engaging in language functions situated in real-world tasks.
Warm-up serves to activate prior knowledge.
Warm-up serves to establish a purpose for the lesson.
Teacher input aligns with the lesson objectives.
Teacher input engages learners in interaction.
Teacher input contains comprehensible input in the target language.
Guided practice aligns with the lesson objectives.
Guided practice flows logically from the teacher input.
Guided practice scaffolds students’ use of new material provided in teacher input.
Independent practice or homework aligns with the lesson objectives.
Independent practice or homework flows logically from the guided practice.
Independent practice or homework allows students to use new material independently in a meaningful way.
Closure allows the teacher to check all students’ progress toward meeting all lesson objectives.
Fosters active engagement of students.
Lesson will allow students to make connections between their own cultural perspectives and those of the target culture in the target language.
Lesson engages students in interpersonal communication.
Lesson engages students in interpretive communication.
Lesson engages students in presentational communication.
Activities show clear connection to learners’ world.
Activities are appropriate for students' level of proficiency.
